1.title: Boat Victory, Human Extinction & Earth Hour
1.plot: The Roast clambers onto an ark as the headlines get swept away, Tony Abbott announces victory over the boats, and global warming announces victory over people.

2.title: Whaling, Budget, Palmer Ad Spending
2.plot: The Roast harpoons the headlines for delicious research purposes, the ICJ rules against Japan, and Joe Hockey announces budget cuts to be shared by all, starting with the person who writes th..

3.title: WA Election, NATO & Russia, & Bankruptcy Charges
3.plot: The Roast throws the headlines' shiny red ball over a cliff, Abbott accuses Palmer of buying seats, and NATO breaks up with Russia. Expect Russia and Crimea cosy Facebook pics to inspire jealousy.

4.title: Royal Commisson, Environmental Boycotts & Tobacco
4.plot: The Roast weaves a fine cloak out of endangered headlines, the Royal Commission is digging into union corruption, and the Coalition makes moves to ban environmental boycotts. Polluted boycotts still ok.

5.title: Roast Recap 1
5.plot: The Roast retraces its stories to find evidence for what it did this week. If for some reason you're home a Friday night, watch it.

6.title: WA Election Special & Headlines
6.plot: The Roast accidentally backs over the headlines' pet and replaces it with an unconvincing lookalike, and we bring you a WA election special. Look at you WA, getting your own special. Well played.

7.title: Free Trade, Solar Energy & McDonalds
7.plot: The Roast hires a scary clown when it's not even the headlines' birthday, Australia strikes a Free Trade Agreement with Japan, and solar energy is suffering. Thank goodness for infinite coal.

8.title: Abbott in Asia, Senate Staff & Clive Palmer
8.plot: The Roast eats all the headlines' nibbles then leaves, more secretarial staff in the senate needed, and Tony Abbott continues his Asian tour. While he's away, shall we legalise something weird?

9.title: Carr's Diaries, Teen Drinking, & David Jones
9.plot: The Roast replaces the headlines' family with out-of-work actors, we look at Bob Carr's diaries, and young people are drinking less thanks to social media. Also, they're just doing less.

10.title: Roast Recap 2
10.plot: The Roast bundles together the best bits from the week so that even lazy fans of the show can keep up to date.

11.title: Retirement Age, ABC Cuts & Polls
11.plot: The Roast sends the headlines' grandparents back to the mill, the government is to raise retirement age to 70, and cuts loom for the ABC, starting with the hashtag department. #Roas.

12.title: 18C Polls, Heartbleed, Lambie on Q&A
12.plot: The Roast accesses and sells the headlines' passwords, 88% of people polled oppose changes to 18C, and Heartbleed haunts the internet.

13.title: The Royal Visit & Barry O'Farrell Quits
13.plot: The Roast snaps photos of the headlines wearing something offensive at a fancy dress party, and we bring you our Royal visit special, including baby George's latest tell-all confessional.

14.title: O'Farrall, Australian Network & Louise Pratt
14.plot: We give the headlines a cheap bottle of Sauvignon Roast, Barry O'Farrell quits as NSW premier, and China to get Australian Network.

15.title: Roast Recap 3
15.plot: If you've had a $3000 bottle of wine and have therefore lost your memory, then worry not, The Roast is here to recap the past week for you with highlights from the news.

16.title: Royals, Brandis & Climate, Rudd for UN
16.plot: The Roast analyses the headlines' designer dress, the royals continue their Australia trip, and Brandis defends the rights of climate sceptics, though those rights could just be a conspiracy.

17.title: Royals, Clive Palmer & Aussie Spies
17.plot: The Roast bulk-bills the headlines then gives them a lollipop, Clive Palmer vows to block the the Direct Action Policy and Indonesia slams Australian spies, though not in a sexy, James Bond way.

18.title: Labor Vs Unions, Fighter Jets & Climate Sceptics
18.plot: The Roast spends $12bn on flying death headlines, Shorten pushes Labor reforms, and government to invest in state-of-the-art fighter jets to defend us from all those sky dangers.

19.title: Hockey, Anzac Day & Apple
19.plot: The Roast puts the headlines in an expensive old folks' home and runs away, we look at ANZAC day souvenirs, and Hockey waxes mysterious about the budget. Hockey you tease.

20.title: Roast Recap 4
20.plot: Like a satirical buffet, we lay out the week's best bits from the show for you to pile onto your mind-plate.

21.title: Logies, Palmer and NT & Popes
21.plot: The Roast photobombs the headlines' selfie, Clive Palmer attracts three new MPs, and two popes get inducted into the heaven hall of fame.

22.title: Palmer, ICAC & Manus Island
22.plot: The Roast tries to be the last organisation not investigated by ICAC, and investigates Four Corners' Manus Island investigation.

23.title: Defecit Levy & Star Wars VII
23.plot: The Roast promises the headlines it won't make fun of them and then does so anyway, and Tony Abbott may tax the rich. It's our "We would never have predicted that" special.

24.title: Commission of Audit, Fight Club & Labor News Service
24.plot: The Roast uploads the headlines' soul to a mainframe and then wipes the hard drive, we look at the Commission of Audit and a Young Liberals' Fight Club which has clearly forgotten the first rule.

25.title: Roast Recap 5
25.plot: In case the Commission of Audit suggested cuts to your memories, allow The Roast to take you through the week's events, and then maybe to lunch? Would you like to have lunch with us?

26.title: Hockey, University Fees & Sexting
26.plot: The Roast takes the headlines for a $22,000 dinner and forgets its wallet, we look at a lunch with Hockey, and university fees set to increase, possibly to the price of a lunch with Hockey.

27.title: Packer, Piracy & Q&A Protest
27.plot: The Roast and the headlines get into a brawl in the street, a student protest disrupts Q&A, and Brandis clamps down on online piracy. That's on The Roast, 8:10pm, or right now on Pirate Bay.

28.title: Australia's Reputation, Chaplaincy Program & Postal Service
28.plot: The Roast puts hungry piranhas in the headlines' bathtub, there are threats to the school chaplaincy program, and falling international opinion of Australia. You're welcome North Korea.

29.title: Labor's Mess, Fairfax Strike & Eurovision
29.plot: The Roast leaps out of a car while driving the headlines over a cliff, the Coalition looks back at Labor's mess, and Fairfax staff go on strik- Hey get out of our office, we don't need more writers.

30.title: Roast Recap 6
30.plot: Like Fairfax journalists, we're not coming into work. Lucky for you we already have our weekly recap ready to go.

31.title: Hockey's Cigar, Agency Cuts & Laurie Oakes
31.plot: The Roast blows cigar smoke into the headlines' face from 200 yards away and we look at the proposed cuts to 76 government agencies. Agency for Cutting Agencies said to be safe.

32.title: Labor Fronts Royal Commission & Pre Budget Analysis
32.plot: The Roast goes ape-shit on a cameraman in the headlines and we bury our collective head deep into a Budget document we haven't seen yet.

33.title: Budget Life Advice
33.plot: The Roast spends all the headlines' money on a pregnant F-15, and we bring you the latest on the budget. Spoiler alert: your favourite things got cut.

34.title: GST, Uni Fees & Gillards Autobiography
34.plot: The Roast throws the headlines off the cliff of financial optimism, we look at the newly angered state premiers and soaring uni fees. Just as well knowledge is wealth - sort of.

35.title: Roast Recap 7
35.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

36.title: Unemployment, Abbott Polls & COAG
36.plot: The Roast chops up the headlines and mixes them into a stew, we look at youth unemployment and Tony Abbott slumps in the polls. Lucky Abbott's employed or he'd have two things to worry about.

37.title: Labor Reforms, Naplan Stress & Hockey Q&A
37.plot: The Roast upgrades the headlines' phone so the old charger no longer works, Bill Shorten faces disunity among party members, and NAPLAN stresses out school kids. Just wait for HECS kids.

38.title: Credit Rating, Student Protests & Jacqui Lambie
38.plot: The Roast winks like a giggly child at the headlines' misfortunes, we look at Australia's credit rating and continuing student protests. Don't they have a university to go t - oh - probably not.

39.title: Medicare Copayment & Abbott's Worst Week
39.plot: The Roast collects $7 from the headlines after they've dropped their pants and coughed, we look at the PM's worst week, and medical co-payments. It's a good time to be in perfect health and not age.

40.title: Roast Recap 8
40.plot: In case your television was also cut in the budget, you still have time to catch up on this week's stories in our recap of the week's biggest stories. Just need to find a friend with a TV.

41.title: Budget in Senate, Budget Criticism & Pipe Bomb
41.plot: The Roast tells the headlines to shut up and stop complaining about the budget, and we bring you the latest in the budget developments.

42.title: Bronwyn Bishop Bias, Roger Rogerson & Palmer and Pensioners
42.plot: The Roast sexy's up the headlines to get clicks, Roger Rogerson gets arrested, and Bronwyn Bishop faces accusations of bias, but she's not the ABC so the Coalition probably won't mind.

43.title: Brandis, Senate Costings and Liberal MP Defects
43.plot: The Roast puts the headlines in a creepy maze with no exit, we look at Senate Estimates and Brandis still under fire for the Racial Discrimination Act. It's like people don't like racism or something.

44.title: Young Hockey, ABC Funding & Google Cars
44.plot: The Roast puts on a tutu and pirouettes into the headlines, Joe Hockey under fire, and Peppa Pig under threat, but no pig puns on The Roast, not even hammy o- *The EPG writer has been fired*

45.title: Roast Recap 9
45.plot: If you've been preparing for the incoming budget by living in the wild and nibbling moss, worry not, as we've compiled our favourite bits from the week's news stories.

46.title: Turnbull, Uni Fees & Dio Wang
46.plot: The Roast pushes an iceberg towards the HMS headlines, we look at the potential changes to HECS fees, and explore rumours surrounding a Turnbull challenge for leadership.

47.title: Obama and Abbott, Andrew Bolt & IOS8
47.plot: The Roast starts a rumour about the headlines to get more attention, Obama sets environmental policy in motion, and we look at the Bolt / Turnbull situation. No reason, we just want to get mentioned in Parliament.

48.title: VIC Turmoil, Palmer & Indonesia
48.plot: The Roast plays really loud guitar all night next door to the headlines, we look at the turmoil in Victoria and the reaction to Clive Palmer's insensitive comment.

49.title: Libs v Nationals, Abbott Abroad & Commonwealth Games
49.plot: The Roast tells the headlines that Santa is real but dead, the Liberals are accused of tricking the Nationals, and we follow Abbott's progress abroad. While he's away, let's go all out with the bias.

50.title: Roast Recap 10
50.plot: If you're like Tony Abbott and you're overseas, here is all the week's news in one handy recap. Don't know why you'd watch this if you're overseas. Go outside and enjoy yourself.

51.title: Pup Senators in the States & Dinner with Abbott
51.plot: The Roast flies the headlines to Boston to learn about Australia, and we look at the PUP senators' educational adventures in the States. It's our "Who on Earth Thought That Was A Good Idea?" special.

52.title: Abbott Vs Obama, Shark Cull & Palmer Rebuttal
52.plot: The Roast puts a Great White in the headlines' bathtub, we look at Abbott's fight against Obama on climate, and the shark cull in WA. Basically a bad day for the Roast.

53.title: Where's Labor, Inflatable Jesus & Coalition In-Fighting
53.plot: The Roast changes all the locks on the headlines' home, we try to find Labor, and look at a questionable ad campaign from Sportsbet. Usually these gambling companies are so easy to look up to.

54.title: Hockey and Budget, World Cup & Jamie Oliver
54.plot: The Roast gets excited by headlines about a ball moving from some grass to some other grass, we look at Hockey's reaction to budget criticism, and the build up to the World Cup in our new not-really-news segment.

55.title: Roast Recap 11
55.plot: In case you've been travelling around the world trying to assemble an awful Avengers-style team of climate sceptics, worry not: we've put together this recap of all our favourite stories from the week.

56.title: Bikies, Tasmanian Forest & Abbott in Texas
56.plot: The Roast prints headlines on a 3,000-year-old tree, we look at new bikie laws and the government's plans to delist Tasmanian forest as a World Heritage Site. While we're at it, that Eiffel Tower? Chop it down.

57.title: ISIS, Welfare, Cory Bernardi & the Tea Party
57.plot: The Roast photoshops a funny hat on the headlines to get more clicks, we tell you all about ISIS and look at the end of the "age of entitlements". Funny name for an age that.

58.title: Labor and Asylum Seekers, National Service & Japan Whaling
58.plot: The Roast checks how many headlines there are by ramming a harpoon through them, Labor assesses its asylum seeker policy and we look at National Service solving our selfishness. Dumb story: it's not even about me.

59.title: Double Dissolution, Google Spy Kids & Coles' Old Bread
59.plot: The Roast accuses the headlines of bias for only reporting facts, we look at calls for a double dissolution, and Google is collecting data on school kids' web activity. Expect the war with Child Terminators to begin shortly.

60.title: Roast Recap 12
60.plot: Sometimes living in the past is healthy. The Roast lives in the past and takes a look at the last weeks top stories, because - Health.

61.title: Labor Criticism, Julie Bishop & Winter Solstice
61.plot: The Roast photoshops something on the headlines and pretends it's news, we look at Labor's critical review of itself, and North Korea threatens Julie Bishop with the nothing they have.

62.title: UNESCO, Japanese Dancing & Abbott Letters
62.plot: The Roast reads the headlines' mail, we look at the recent rulings on Chaplains, Visas and Trees, and Japan considers lifting a ban on dancing, so good news for prisoners on the 3:10 Sushi Train to Yuma.

63.title: Phone Hacking, Greens & Japanese Robots
63.plot: The Roast listens to the headlines' juiciest voicemail messages, we look at the verdicts of the News Corp trials, and the Greens' opposition to a green policy.

64.title: Palmer and Gore & Suarez Biting
64.plot: The Roast puts a red sock in the headlines' whites laundry, and we look at the revelations from Clive Palmer's big change of mind after a brief meeting with Al Gore. Also, Al Gore is a Jedi.

65.title: Roast Recap 13
65.plot: If you've had your head in the sand hiding from climate science for the past week, why not surface for some air and a catch up on the week's news with our recap?

66.title: Senate Guide, NRL Incident & Scott Morrison
66.plot: The Roast repeatedly whispers "It's not your fault" to the headlines until they break down crying, we start looking at the incoming senate, and controversy within NRL.

67.title: Farewell Senators, Family First & Welfare Changes
67.plot: The Roast slaps an ice cream out of the headlines' hands, and we don't even allow the incoming senators one day in the job before getting stuck into them. Bet they feel special.

68.title: Pup in Senate, Facebook Manipulation & Tax Letters
68.plot: The Roast surgically removes puns from the headlines, we look at the history of the PUP, and examine revelations that Facebook is manipulating our feelings. If that depresses you, find some kitten pics.

69.title: Senate Week, CBA Scandal & Graeme Innes Leaves
69.plot: The Roast repossess the headlines' home thanks to aggressive lending, we end our Senate Week coverage, and look into the current CBA fraud sCANdal.

70.title: Roast Recap 14
70.plot: If you're a new incoming senator and have spent the week desperately reading up on your new terrifying job, you can catch up on all the week's events with The Roast's Recap.

71.title: Same-Sex Families, Asylum Seekers & Jacqui Lambie
71.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

72.title: Scott Morrison, Palmer Upstages & Pink Floyd Album
72.plot: The Roast puts a beehive in the headlines' sock drawer, Palmer upstages his senators, and we look at the growing media focus on asylum seekers. Was it a media blackout or media spotlight?

73.title: Muir's Amendment, Shinzo Abe & Roast Breakfast
73.plot: The Roast lets the headlines kill dolphins for research purposes, we look at Shinzo Abe's speech, and Ricky Muir fights for the environment, like Captain Planet if he loved motor vehicles.

74.title: Indonesian Elections & World Cup
74.plot: The Roast makes the headlines pay $11bn to be demoralised in their own country, we look at the Indonesian election, plus more World Cup coverage. Brazilians best change the channel during the second half of the show.

75.title: Isreal-Palestine, Work for the Dole & Abbott and Lies
75.plot: The Roast makes its team write headlines for $10 an hour, we look at the Israel-Palestine conflict, and examine work for the dole. Whatever happened to "be on the dole for the dole" or "the dole" as it was known?

76.title: Asylum Seekers, Dodgy Medecine & Commonwealth Games
76.plot: The Roast hides sad headlines under a media blackout, we look at more recent developments with asylum seekers, and examine medicine that can kill you. The Roast: side effects may include cynicism and laughter.

78.title: 18C, Terrorism Laws & Ricky Muir
78.plot: The Roast makes sure all the headlines are on Team Australia, and we look at the effects of leaving 18C and the Coalition's suggested terrorism laws. If you're a racist terrorist, all the worse for you.

79.title: Brandis & Metadata
79.plot: The Roast meta-reads the headlines but not the contents, and we look at Brandis' attempts to explain his own policies. Something to do with envelopes and addresses so that people living in the 80s can understand.

80.title: Roast Recap 15
80.plot: If you've been trying to stay off the grid so that the government can't harvest your metadata, worry not. You can catch up with the news in our weekly recap. Just destroy the television when you're done.

81.title: Abbott's Lies.Com, Sitting Is Bad & Ape Selfies
81.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

82.title: Young Liberals, Internships & Mathias Cormann
82.plot: The Roast sends the headlines to the kitchen where they belong, we look at the financial burden of internships, and examine misogyny amongst Young Liberals. It's like The Coalition: Kids.

83.title: Iraq, Democracy & Costello
83.plot: The Roast follows the headlines into a war-zone, we look at Australian involvement in Iraq, and 40% of Australians are apparently losing faith in democracy: still a landslide win for democracy overall though.

84.title: Shorten Vs Hockey, the Budget & Pyne's Birthday
84.plot: The Roast zooms past headlines walking along the side of the road being all poor, and we look at "Foghorn Leghorn" Joe Hockey: yes, Joe Hockey, that Texan rooster. - wait, what?

85.title: Roast Recap 16
85.plot: If you missed The Roast this week because you're still walking home from work because you're not rich and don't drive, worry not. We've compiled the best bits of the week for all you povvo walkers just getting home.

86.title: Climate in the Media, Health & Phone Tapping
86.plot: The Roast ignores 97% of the headlines that contain facts, we look at Maurice Newman's contribution to the climate science debate, and explore what's killing us this week. Watch us if you want to live.

87.title: Julian Assange, Ice Bucket Challenge & Clive Palmer
87.plot: The Roast shaves the beard off of headlines that have been living in an embassy for 2 years, we look at the current situation with Julian Assange, and nominate no one to do the Ice Bucket Challenge.

88.title: Team Australia & Jacqui Lambie
88.plot: The Roast changes all headlines to the words "Australian Flag", and we look into the growing concept of Team Australia. That's tonight on TABC: Team Australian Broadcasting Company.

89.title: R.I.P. Great Barrier Reef & Young Politics
89.plot: The Roast dumps tonnes of satirical dredge on the headlines, and we look at the fate of the Great Barrier Reef. Not to give anything away, but we should probably change its name to Grave Barrier Reef.

90.title: Roast Recap 17
90.plot: If, like the writers and production staff of this show, you've been trapped in your workplace for a whole week, here's your chance to catch up on the week's events.

91.title: Scott Morrison, Media Botch & Mobiles on Planes
91.plot: The Roast says all headlines are dangerous because of one extremist headline, we look at The Daily Telegraph's media botch, and Scott Morrison leaves his media blackout to answer questions.

92.title: Disability Wage Review & Rudd Gillard Book
92.plot: The Roast's dog accidentally fouls on the headlines' lawn, and we take a look at the amazingly fair wages being paid to people with intellectual disabilities. Also, sarcasm.

93.title: NBN Cost-Benefit Analysis & Pup Kills GP Co-Payment
93.plot: The Roast delivers high speed headlines and the Coalition releases a cost-benefit analysis report on the high speed NBN.

94.title: Roast Recap 18
94.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

96.title: Renewable Energy Target & Julia Gillard Interview
96.plot: The Roast plunges into a time portal and finds headlines about Julia Gillard, and we look at the fate of the Renewable Energy Target. This just in: success is bad, so start failing if you want to survive.

97.title: Australia in Iraq & Federal Arts Funding
97.plot: The Roast makes the headlines walk the plank yet again in a 5th Pirates movie and we examine Australia's role in fighting ISIS. Also, if anyone from ISIS is reading this: tonight's episode is about how awful the US is.

98.title: Mining Tax Repeal Superannuation & Lambie Ice Bucket
98.plot: The Roast pours a bucket of headlines all over the television and we take a closer look at the after effects of the mining tax repeal. Sadly a debate on the Comedy Writers Tax has failed to reach the Senate.

99.title: Gamergate, Misogyny & Bob Day
99.plot: The Roast sits in the house with the red seats and squirms through Bob Day's maiden speech and we take a closer look at sexism in gaming, an issue that seems as hard to beat as Tetris level 30.

100.title: Roast Recap 19
100.plot: If you've been working overtime this week to desperately cobble together a better superannuation, you might have missed this week's news. Thankfully, we've put together this recap.

101.title: Australia Fund & One Year of Parliament
101.plot: Unlike Oasis, the Roast decides to looks back in anger at the last year in politics, and we look at Palmer's live-action Australia Fund in a not so live-action way.

102.title: Hawking, Royal Baby & Scotland
102.plot: The Roast reads Stephen Hawking's new book and we look at the debate surrounding Scottish independence, it's like a Scotch Finger; split down the middle and delicious with milk.

103.title: Apple Watch & New Submarines
103.plot: The Roast yells 'Up Periscope!' and examines Australia's new submarine purchase, then torpedos the announcement of the new Apple Watch.

104.title: Community Television & Gene Patenting
104.plot: The Roast finally tunes in to Community Television only to find out it's getting the boot, then looks into gene patenting, before realising it has no right to make money off Gene Wilder.

105.title: Roast Recap 20
105.plot: The Roast recaps the biggest stories of the week, from Scottish independence and iGasms to a scathing review of the first year of the Abbott Government.

106.title: Terror Alert Level & Black Caviar
106.plot: The Roast sires jokes about Black Caviar's daughter and Team Australia gets high on terror alerts.

107.title: New Zealand Election & Pollie Recognition Survey
107.plot: The Roast looks at the day's headlines and a showdown in New Zealand between an internet entrepreneur and the government. We understand Peter Jackson has already bought the film rights.

108.title: China Coal, Panda Sex & Polio
108.plot: The Roast looks at China's changes to coal import rules and Clive Palmer's voting record. It's not as impressive as his napping record.

109.title: Medical Marijuana & Food Star Ratings
109.plot: The Roast uses star ratings to find healthy food and medical marijuana moves one step closer to legalisation. Good news if you're health conscious and have the munchies.

110.title: Roast Recap 21
110.plot: If at first you don't succeed try and try again. It appears we didn't succeed in getting you to watch these bits the first time, so here they are again in the Roast Recap.

111.title: Terrorism, John Howard & Lambie and the Brick
111.plot: The Roast looks at John Howard's big TV interview and Jacqui Lambie's comments on terrorism and Iraq. It's a great time for anyone who really misses 2003.

112.title: Terrorism Legislation, Tony Abbott & Climate Change
112.plot: The Roast flies first class with PM Tony Abbott to not attend a UN climate change summit and domestic terrorism fears mount. Fear and temperature levels are rising.

113.title: Gillard Interview & Charity Sector Regulator
113.plot: The Roast throws its two cents into the government's Charity Sector Regulator bucket. Here's hoping we can claim it as a tax write off.

114.title: Kevin Rudd, Emma Watson & 4Chan
114.plot: The Roast tells you that Kevin Rudd called Julia Gillard's memoir 'fiction' and an online reaction to Emma Watson's UN speech is stranger than fiction.

115.title: Roast Recap 22
115.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

116.title: Cambodia Refugee Deal & Clooney's Wedding
116.plot: The Roast didn't get invited to George Clooney's wedding, so instead uses the time to look at our refugee deal with Cambodia. To any Cambodian refugees, at least you'll speak the language when you're resettled.

117.title: Corporate Tax Avoidance & ABC Cuts
117.plot: The Roast looks into tax evasion and ABC budget cuts. So if Lateline gets cancelled, send your complaints to the Cayman Islands.

118.title: Newman Inquiry & Hong Kong Protests
118.plot: Hong Kong protests against China and the Coalition protests that Clive Palmer's Senate inquiry is a vendetta against the Qld Premier.

119.title: Burqa, Terrorism Laws & Leyonhjelm
119.plot: The Roast spies on David Leyonhjelm's speech about tobacco tax and hopes its coverage about new anti-terror laws doesn't get us spied on by ASIO.

120.title: Roast Recap 23
120.plot: The Roast Recap. Stories include the protests in Hong Kong and the shutdown of The Australia Network. So shutdown your other plans to catch up on the week's news.

121.title: WA Crime Prevention & Olfactory Senses
121.plot: The Roast examines CCTV footage in WA and smells it to make sure our olfactory senses are working before singing glory glory to the headlines.

122.title: Greg Hunt, NZ Govt Texts & Twin Peaks
122.plot: The Roast checks Greg Hunt's facts on Climate Change. Turns out Wikipedia isn't a peer-reviewed scientific journal after all.

123.title: Labor Reform, John Faulkner & the Dole
123.plot: The Roast looks at calls for Labor Party reform. Actual reform seems unlikely, though. The only thing the Labor Party likes to change is their leader.

124.title: Ebola, Pup & Bloodmoon
124.plot: The Roast dives into the Palmer United Party and surfaces as confused and disoriented as we are by Australia's inaction on Ebola.

125.title: Roast Recap 24
125.plot: The Roast recap gets bored with the ALP's attempts to reform itself, hot in a changing climate and sick with Ebola in Africa - so get ready to turn that frown, even more down.

126.title: Racist Rants & Curriculum Review
126.plot: The Roast crams for the school curriculum review, and then gets kicked off the bus after shouting the findings at some unsuspecting passenger.

127.title: Putin and G20, Abbott & Coal
127.plot: The Roast finds a physically threatening way to interpret news as we look at Abbott's promise to "shirtfront" Vladimir Putin. In tomorrow's news, Abbott will have mysteriously disappeared.

128.title: Daily Telegraph, Media Bias & Counterfeit Goods
128.plot: The Daily Telegraph uncovers some striking media bias involving NSW Premier Mike Baird and a shady media publication called 'The Daily Telegraph'.

129.title: Egg Freezing, Foreign Subs & Adelaide Election
129.plot: The Roast lets Apple and Facebook freeze its eggs in case it one day wants to have a more miniature version of a 10 minute show.

130.title: Roast Recap 25
130.plot: The Roast recap shirt-fronts the week's news. Stories include Abbott v Putin, racism on public transport and a guide for those doing final year exams. Exam tip: the answer is C. Even in the essay questions.

131.title: Girly Man, Burqa Backflip & Fish Sex
131.plot: The Roast lifts the veil on the Parliament's reversal of the burqa ban and embarks on an epic quest to destroy the phrase "girly man" once and for all.

132.title: Gough Whitlam, Uni Professor's Emails & Killing Us This Week
132.plot: The Roast checks its email account, deletes offensive emails from a university professor, tags Killing Us This Week and puts the death of former PM Gough Whitlam in the "sad news" folder.

133.title: Asteroid Spotting, Aussie ISIS Teen & Fairfax CH10 Merger
133.plot: The Roast freaks out over the new ISIS video and the end of our asteroid-spotting program. Now we'll never know when the world will end. Meaning today is as good a time as ever to make passionate love to your ex.

134.title: Scott Morrison, Palmer United Party & Gough Whitlam's Greens
134.plot: The Roast joins the Palmer United Party in Mrs Palmer's place and offers to take on the responsibility of fighting Ebola. So far the plan is to make fun of it until it promises to stop doing what it's doing.

135.title: Roast Recap 26
135.plot: The Roast rewatches the teen ISIS video, pines for a time when you were allowed to fight in a cage in Melbourne and remembers that ridiculous comment Mathias Cormann made.

136.title: Ricky Muir, the Queen Tweets, Shorten Speech & Movie Pirating
136.plot: The Roast looks at Bill Shorten's defence of gay marriage and the makers of Dallas Buyers Club are on the hunt for internet pirates. So bad news for everyone in Dallas Stealers Club.

137.title: Trans-Pacific Partnership, Great Barrier Reef & ISDS
137.plot: The Roast looks at the negatives of a multilateral Free Trade Agreement and the destruction of the Great Barrier Reef. So bad news for anyone who isn't money or a dead fish.

138.title: Fuel Prices & Uni Fees
138.plot: The Roast becomes 40 cents more expensive as we examine a potential rise in fuel prices, and we look at uni fees. If you drive to uni you should basically give up now.

139.title: Direct Action & Jacqui Lambie
139.plot: The PUP backs the Direct Action Plan and Jacqui Lambie attempts to pull the wool over our eyes and the burkas off our faces.

140.title: Roast Recap 27
140.plot: You wake up in a cold sweat, you don't know where you are and you've missed a week's worth of life. Luckily the Roast Recap is here to catch you up.

141.title: Climate Report & Goodbye Roast
141.plot: Brisbane prepares itself for G20 and the UN prepares planet earth for some bad news. SPOILER: It's *not* that the earth's pregnant.

142.title: Melbourne Cup, Art Theft & George Brandis
142.plot: The Roast covers the Melbourne Cup and then the National Gallery art scandal, heeding the age old advice not to put the art before the horse.

143.title: Ebola & Melbourne Cup
143.plot: The Roast puts the Australian government's response to ebola under the microscope. Spoiler Alert: we find tiny traces of reluctant sympathy.

144.title: Goodbye from the Roast
144.plot: The Roast says goodbye to Australia's politicians and previews what we would have done if we were to return in 2015.

145.title: Roast Recap 28
145.plot: The Roast takes a look back at the week's news and it's a little awkward because we already said goodbye to it.

 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: North Korea & G'Day China
1.plot: North Korea evicts ambassadors and Julia Gillard announces Chinese trade show. Like the Easter show, but all the toys are made in China - Oh wait.

2.title: NBN & Stingray Sign
2.plot: Tonight's Roast isn't about Margaret Thatcher. We promise.

3.title: Asylum Seekers & Space Policy
3.plot: Asylum seekers reach WA, and Australia launches its first space policy. Off-planet refugee processing facility soon to follow.

4.title: New Train Line, Rainbow Crossing & Meth Seizure
4.plot: Government deletes rainbow, plans high speed train, and scores meth - sorry seizes meth - expect rainbows everywhere tomorrow.

5.title: Howard Attends Thatchers Funeral, Cars Recalled & Qantas
5.plot: Thatcher's funeral, Toyota car recall, and Qantas offends people who have an over-entitled attachment to bacon.

6.title: School Funding, Beiber at Anne Frank's House & Nepal TV Host
6.plot: Govt announces more school funding, Bieber announces he's a narcissist, and Nepal TV host announces "Buddha was born in Nepal" - for 62 hours.

7.title: Undercover Students, Venezuela Elections & Pakistan Spy Falcon
7.plot: Venezuala elects new president, BBC uses students as cover and Pakistan sends a bird to India.

8.title: Al Qaeda Magazine, Social Media Jurors & Hanson
8.plot: Pauline Hanson, trials by twitter, and an Al Qaeda magazine. A magazine? You go Al Qaeda; maybe try Myspace next.

9.title: NZ Gay Marriage, BBC and ABC Split & Black Caviar
9.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

10.title: Op Shop Money, Telstra & Hunting
10.plot: Tonight, lucky Telstra has won a $1.1bn contract, and a lucky op-shop has been left $50k in a suitcase. Also, in NSW national parks, lucky animals can now be shot.

11.title: Cleo, Boston & Swan's Defecit
11.plot: We're in serious debt according to Wayne Swan. Gen-Y is conservative according to Cleo. The Czech Republic is Chechnya according to US twitter users.

12.title: Sports Funding, Croc Farming & RSL's
12.plot: We're going to win the Olympics in running shoes made out of a crocodile's face. How? Tune in to The Roast tonight to find out.

13.title: Twitter Hack, Gay Marriage & Fake Bomb Detectors
13.plot: Tonight, France legalises gay marriage, someone sells fake bomb detectors, and media twitter accounts get hacked.

14.title: NSW Breath Tests & Harold Holt
14.plot: From the Roast Archives: NSW gets Random Breath Testing and Prime Minister Harold Holt drowns. Should have caught a water taxi. It's a 'Classic Roast'.

15.title: Clive Palmer, Game of Thrones & Chinese Worms
15.plot: Australia is downloading Game of Thrones too much. A cartoon helps Chinese kids get rid of tapeworms and Clive Palmer's new political party. WARNING: May contain graphic violence, tapeworms, and images of Clive Palmer.

16.title: Space Trash, Everest Punch-Up & Car Parks
16.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

17.title: Oz Airports, QLD Hospitals & Black Caviar
17.plot: Tonight we read our airports report cards. Also, QLD health minister complains about complaints and a Twitter user asks if Black Caviar used steroids. So far Ms. Caviar has not responded - Because she's a horse.

18.title: Internet, Craig Thompson & the King of Holland
18.plot: Talking about Dutch royals, Craig Thomson's legal fees and the internet's 20th birthday.

19.title: Myer, Justice of the Peace & ACL
19.plot: Tonight the CEO of Myer thinks money is good, the Australian Christian Lobby opposes something bad and QLD Justices of the peace get to decide who is good and who is bad.

20.title: Hollywood Guns, Queensland Monarchy & Breast Show
20.plot: Looking at Hollywood's opposition to gun control, Queensland accepting female monarchs, and a reality show about naked women.

21.title: Skywhale, Clive Palmer and Peter Slipper & the Pope
21.plot: Clive Palmer denies Peter Slipper membership, the Pope canonises 800 new saints, and Canberra launches a "Skywhale". Expect Clive Palmer's "Skywhale II" soon.

22.title: Budget Night, Gallipoli & Insect Eating
22.plot: In tonight's episode: tour operators oversell tickets to Gallipoli centenary, UN suggests eating insects, and it's budget night. That's right: two interesting stories. Also, it's budget night.

23.title: After Budget, Queue Jumping & Chris Hadfield
23.plot: In tonight's show, Chris Hadfield returns from space, we cover queue-jumpers in Disneyland, and look at the budget: good news, the ABC got more money. Hopefully now we can afford one more special effects dog-sequence this year.

24.title: Food Poisoning, Wine & Nuclear Waste
24.plot: Tonight we investigate the food poisoning outbreak in Canberra, the effect of global warming on the wine industry, and nuclear waste being transported through Sydney. The Roast - now with superhuman powers and bizarre growths. - that also have powers.

25.title: Budget Reply, Eurovision & Immigration Zone
25.plot: Abbott has prolonged our budget reporting by replying to the budget, and Eurovision's about to begin. Fortunately we don't have to report on these stories because, like immigration, we're pretending we don't exist.

26.title: Space Pests, Baby Bonus & Immunisation
26.plot: Looking at the soon-to-be reduced baby bonus, immunisation-only schools, and Russia's bid to be the first country to send animals into space and successfully bring them back completely dead.

27.title: Pro Same-Sex Marriage Rudd, Nutella Day & Gambling
27.plot: Tonight on the Roast, we look at live gambling odds in SA, the cancellation of World Nutella Day, and Rudd's revelation as being pro gay marriage. Great news: now gay couples in 2007 can get married.

28.title: Pope's Exorcism, Trains & Privatising the ABC
28.plot: Tonight, the Pope allegedly performs an exorcism, we look at the pros and cons of "singles" carriages on trains, and liberals propose privatising the ABC. All that on The Roast, soon to be 8 minutes long with 2 minutes of ads.

29.title: Westralia, Gun Blitz & Xenophon
29.plot: Tonight, we look at WA potentially seceding from Australia, the police's new campaign against firearms, and, after Nick Xenophon, The Roast team become the final people in Australia to not start their own political party.

30.title: Chemical List, Venezuelan Toilet Paper & Car Factories
30.plot: Job fears as Ford announces factory closures, toilet fears as Venezuala runs out of toilet paper, and security fears as Gov't releases a terrorist chemical watch list.

31.title: Ban on Live Odds, Vivid Censorship & the Palmer Party
31.plot: Tonight, we look at the celebrity members of Palmer's party, a nationwide ban on live odds, and censorship at the Vivid Festival: we submitted our own photo of a d***fl**ing shadow p***sh*nt but they wouldn't show it.

32.title: Pell, China Hacks ASIO & Sports Food
32.plot: Tonight, Cardinal Pell apologises for child-abuse cover-ups, celebrity sports people influence our dieting habits, and China allegedly hacks the ASIO mainframe. How did they do that when they don't even have a proper Google?

33.title: Bill Gates, ASOS & Election Funding Increase
33.plot: After failing to develop superpowers, The Roast team are returning their radioactive ASOS belts. Also, election funding has been increased, and Bill Gates asks for more taxes on the rich: he's a real hero. Not like us - we just have radiation poisoning.

34.title: Sexting, Racist McGuire & East Timor Spying
34.plot: The Roast looks at Eddie Mcguire's "King Kong" comment, Australia's spying on East Timor, and changes to sexting laws.

35.title: Steroids, Syria & Raw Milk
35.plot: The Roast covers the increase in steroid use, raw milk and a bookshop where young men are being encouraged to fight in Syria. The only thing our bookshop has encouraged us to do is buy a Christine Anu CD, but we already had it.

36.title: Whale Meat, Asbestos NBN & Calls for a Republic
36.plot: Tonight we look at Telstra digging up asbestos during their NBN rollout, Australia thinking about becoming a republic again, and Japan promotes whale meat as nutritious - thank goodness whales are infinite in number and immune to pain.

37.title: Tsunami Funds, Minimum Wage & Channel 9 Cricket
37.plot: In tonight's episode, we look at Japan spending tsunami relief funds on cheese, an increase in minimum wage, and Channel 9 retains cricket. At least we know it's still the same channel we won't watch when the cricket's on.

38.title: Attenborough, Asteroids & Chinese Censorship
38.plot: In tonight's episode we look at China's censorship of Tianaman Square, an Asteroid which narrowly missed earth and David Attenborough's cancellation of his Australian tour. Perhaps he'll send his brother instead, Clive Palmer's probably looking for a John Hammond.

39.title: Bob Carr's Blog, Patenting Podcasts & Labor Infighting
39.plot: Tonight, there's more infighting in Labor, Bob Carr admits he's not writing his blog, and a US company claims to have patented the podcast. Damnit. We'd just patented internet, sounds, and hearing.

40.title: Assange, Kenyan Compensation & Youtube Ban
40.plot: Tonight, Aus govt stops helping Julian Assange, the British Government compensates Kenyan torture victims and Tajikistan President bans YouTube. It's a sad day for the people of Tajikistan, and cats. See you in a week.

41.title: Julia Attacked, PM Rudd & Iranian President
41.plot: In tonight's episode, will Rudd be leader? Also, progressive Australia to get a Ministry for Women, and Iran treats its female leader with scorn and prejudice - wait - sorry, that's the other way round. Well done Iran then.

42.title: Putin Ring Theft, Greek Television & Abbott
42.plot: Tonight, a Greek court demands the return of state television, Abbott gets 8,000 people on the phone, and Putin allegedly steals a $25,000 ring - such a shame, he'd been so nice up until this.

43.title: Beastiality, Riots & TV News
43.plot: Tonight, there are riots in Brazil, a study shows most of Australian TV is news programming, and Cory Bernardi again links gay marriage to polygamy and bestiality: we at The Roast loved animals way before gay marriage was legal anywhere.

44.title: Channel 9, White House Survival Guide & Dolce and Gabbana
44.plot: Tonight, Dolce and Gabbana jailed for tax evasion, the White House release a "School Shooting" survival guide and suggestions Channel 9 may influence cricket team selections...Will choose bad players so the cricket doubles as Funniest Home Videos.

45.title: Instagram Videos, Abbott in the North & Greens Solve Homelessness
45.plot: Tonight we look at Abbott's plan for the north of Australia, a Greens senators plan to house the homeless and Instagram offers a video option. Finally, a way to share videos on the internet. That definitely does not already exist.

46.title: Snowden, Facebook Leak & Gambling Addicts
46.plot: Tonight, Star Casino unveils its proposals for a resort, Edward Snowden is fleeing US prosecution to Ecuador, and Facebook accidentally leaks details of 6 million users, including Snowden's; he's just checked in at a cafe across the street.

47.title: Up 'n' Go, Canyon Tightrope & Sweatshop Conditions
47.plot: Tonight, liquid breakfast drinks aren't as nutritious as you think, a man walks across a big empty space on a tightrope, and Australian supermarkets are using workers in sweatshop conditions, but not us: all of our jokes were written by free-range comedians.

48.title: Knit-Gate, Obama's Executive Power & Snowden
48.plot: Tonight, Snowden is still in a Russian airport, Prime Minister Gillard's knitting photo is apparently controversial, and Obama uses his executive power to tackle climate change - like a dictator, only he listens to science.

49.title: The Spill Special!
49.plot: Tonight, it's our Labor Leadership spill special, not that we want you to think there's anything "special" about Labor spills; there'll probably be another one by the weekend.

50.title: Rudd, Gillard & Banned Video Games
50.plot: Tonight, we look at Rudd's plans for the cabinet, a controversial video game is refused a rating in Australia and what Julia Gillard can look forward to post-leadership: probably knitting up her suit jackets where the knife-wounds are.

51.title: Rudd's New Ministers, Tour De France & the Monorail
51.plot: Tonight, Rudd's popularity goes up in the polls, the Sydney monorail sees its last day, and disaster at the Tour de France as no one takes drugs and takes a normal-human amount of time to finish the race.

52.title: J-Lo, Snowden & Tanning Beds
52.plot: Tonight, Snowden is still in a Russian Airport, Jennifer Lopez controversially performs in Turkmenistan, and the NSW government is initiating a statewide ban on tanning beds: now we'll only be able to get a tan using the abundant Sun we've always had.

53.title: Fairfax Pay Wall, Tally Room Closure & Ed Husic
53.plot: Tonight, Fairfax introduces a pay wall, we say farewell to the national tally room, and Ed Husic comes under fire for taking his oath of office on the Koran - unlike swearing on the Bible which is much better and definitely means people can't lie.

54.title: Egyptian Coup, Bolivian President & Rudd v Abbott
54.plot: Tonight, Snowden causes the president of Bolivia to be held up on a flight, there's an Egyptian military coup, and Rudd has challenged Abbott to a debate - sort of like challenging him to do what they're meant to do every day.

55.title: Kellogg's Ad, Melissa Doyle & Rudd Reforms
55.plot: Tonight, Melissa Doyle set to leave Sunrise, Rudd initiates reforms for NSW branch of Labor to stamp out corruption, and more Kellogg's ads are banned for targeting children: let's hope products for adults can still use cartoon dinosaurs and free toys.

56.title: Qantas Porn, Wimbledon & Anti-Gay Schools
56.plot: Tonight, Andy Murray wins Wimbledon, adult images are uploaded to Qantas' Facebook page, and private schools protest an anti-discriminatory law that could prevent them from expelling gay students: goddamn anti-discriminatory laws and their common sense.

57.title: Tweet Arrest, Taxi Recordings & Rudd
57.plot: Tonight, a teenager is arrested over a tweet at a Pink concert, Rudd suggests Labour leadership voting reforms, and QLD taxis to record video and audio of their passengers, yielding footage that's somehow worse than Celebrity Splash.

58.title: Murdoch, Bin Laden & Giant Ballott Papers
58.plot: Tonight, Rupert Murdoch is called to another parliamentary inquiry, Bin Laden evaded detection using a cowboy hat, and magnifying glasses are issued to help read ballot papers, finally the electoral process is embracing technology.

59.title: Constitution Reforms, Cheap Imports & Aussie Surveillance
59.plot: Tonight, Rudd suggests a change to the constitution, Australia is being flooded with cheap imports, and Wyndham is collecting data on its inhabitants - in leaking this fact, all of The Roast team are now seeking asylum in Ecuador.

60.title: Royal Baby, Gonski in WA & Terrorist Vacuum
60.plot: Tonight, we look at the build up to the Royal baby birth, Western Australia wants the Gonski deadline extended, and the 9/11 mastermind designs blueprints for a vacuum cleaner - the blueprints depict a tunnel out of prison and an escape helicopter.

61.title: Rudd and Asylum, Visa Fraud & Reef Bombing
61.plot: Tonight, the US army has bombed the Great Barrier Reef, Rudd announces his new asylum seeker policy, and visa fraud rates are reaching 50% - well done visa cheats: 50% - that's a pass.

62.title: Royal Baby, War on Porn & Palmer Forgets
62.plot: Tonight, the British Prime Minister wages a war on internet pornography, Clive Palmer forgets a candidate's name, and the Royal baby has been born, creating new job opportunities for infant Royal lookalike wannabes.

63.title: Signatures, Rudd's Royal Gift & 24 Hour Asylum Challenge
63.plot: Tonight, the Roast takes a look at Abbott's 24-hour asylum challenge to Rudd, the eradication of written signatures in favour of PINs, and Rudd's gift to the Royal baby - he just needs to cross out Julia's name on the gift card.

64.title: Abbott vs PNG, WA & Thai Rice Goes Off
64.plot: Tonight, the PNG Prime Minister responds to criticism from Abbott, Thailand's rice stockpiles go off, and WA premiere asks for more thanks.

65.title: Assange Party, Bob Katter & Stationery Spending
65.plot: Tonight, the Roast gets political with the launch of Julian Assange's political party, Bob Katter's campaign video and a crackdown on stationery spending by the QLD government. Next on their agenda: who keeps leaving their tea bags in the sink?

66.title: World Youth Day, Dole Boot Camp & Rudd Overseas
66.plot: Tonight, the Pope speaks at World Youth Day on a beach in Brazil, a proposal to send people wanting the dole to boot camp and Kevin Rudd and his wife visit the troops in Afghanistan. It will go down as their least romantic weekend getaway ever.

67.title: Segways, Social Media & Geoblocking
67.plot: Tonight, Queensland has overturned safety regulations to legalise the extremely necessary Segway, criminals are using social media to corrupt police, and the Aus. Gov't recommends ways to avoid geoblocking: suggestions include entering the world of Tron with a fake digital moustache.

68.title: Obama's Guys, Asylum Tents and Bradley Manning
68.plot: Tonight, Rudd brings in Obama's campaign managers, tent companies might influence the Coalition's asylum-seeker policy, and Bradley Manning is found "not-guilty" of aiding al-Qaeda, thankfully it means he'll probably only get up to 136 years in prison for espionage.

69.title: Labor Corruption, Cigarette Tax & Vodafone
69.plot: Tonight, Vodafone scraps high roaming charges, there are tax hikes on cigarettes and we look at the NSW state Labor corruption inquiry: without "corruption" that sentence would be terrifyingly boring.

70.title: Snowden Asylum, Inflight Gastro & Bank Bailouts
70.plot: Tonight on The Roast: the government moves to establish a bank bailout fund and a Qantas flight gets hijacked by gastro, but first...Edward Snowden has been granted temporary asylum in Russia. After 40 days and 40 nights in a Moscow airport transit lounge.

71.title: Election Announcement
71.plot: Tonight, it's the election announcement special. Expect unending speculation for weeks - weeks.

72.title: Election Campaign, Climate Anger & Science Beef
72.plot: Tonight, it's the first day of the election campaign, climate change affects our moods, and scientists create lab-grown beef creating job-loss fears for cows.

73.title: Election Campaign, QLD Parliament Sex & Breivik
73.plot: Tonight, the second day of the election campaign, Anders Breivik applies for university and Queensland's Parliament rocked by sex scandal. NSW Parliament says it's not as impressive as their scandal.

74.title: Campaigning, Obama Cancels Russia Talks & French Eggs
74.plot: Tonight, Obama cancels talks with Putin, French protesters destroy eggs and conspiracy theories make a terrible election even more terrible.

75.title: Peter Beattie, Election Debate & Gorbachev
75.plot: Tonight, Peter Beattie enters the election race, Gorbachev denies he is dead and Rudd and Abbott commit to a debate. At least they agree on something.

76.title: Leaders Debate, Abbott's Twitter & Prime Minister Taxi Driver
76.plot: Tonight, rumours that Abbott's twitter followers are fake, the Norwegian prime minister poses as a taxi driver, and we look at the leaders debate. Well, at least someone watched it.

77.title: Abbott and Same Sex Marriage, Election Run Up & Sport Politicians
77.plot: Tonight, we look at the first election gaffe, another ex-sports person stands for parliament, and Tony Abbott's stance on same-sex marriage shifts slightly, so slightly that it's confused people into thinking it's exactly the same.

78.title: Sexist Gaffe, Voting Preferences & Election Coverage
78.plot: Tonight, continuing election coverage, we look at more election gaffes, and the Liberal party changes its voting preference. Now if you want the Greens to win, you'll have to vote for them directly.

79.title: Attractive Politicians, Carbon Policy & Election Coverage
79.plot: Tonight, our dedicated election coverage continues, Climate Alert raises issues with both parties' carbon reduction policies, and an Iranian councillor is "too attractive" for public office. In other news, scientists discover "men are often sexist" gene in men.

80.title: Asylum Seeker Policy, Abbott Popularity & Election 2013
80.plot: Tonight, we look at the solutions to asylum seekers, polls show Abbott is more popular and the election is apparently still on. Not watching our coverage may result in a fine.

81.title: Parental Leave, Controversial Website & Election 2013
81.plot: In our continuing election coverage, it's Election Debate 2, Peter Slipper recycles his posters, Abbott considers an NDIS, The Daily Telegraph reveals actress is an actress, there's pre-poll voting, and Kevin Baker stands down.

82.title: Campaign Launch, Boat Buyback & Election 2013
82.plot: Tonight, we bring you the latest in the election, a frenzy of campaign launches, and analysis of the Coalition's boat buyback plan: be prepared to think: "Wow, that's a great policy."

83.title: Naval Bases, Gambling Reform & Election 2013
83.plot: Tonight, the election, is one day closer than yesterday, Labor plans to move naval base, and we look at the Coalition gambling reform policy. We were surprised it doesn't involve shipping gamblers to Nauru.

84.title: Coalition Employment Policy, Abbott Temperament & Election 2013
84.plot: Tonight, our election coverage continues, Rudd questions Abbott's temperament and the Coalition announces unemployment policy. ALP said to be "studying it closely".

85.title: Surplus Plans, Marriage Vouchers & Election 2013
85.plot: Tonight, we continue our election coverage and will never stop, we look at the Coalition's plans for getting back into surplus, as well as vouchers for married couples: finally, an incentive to marry other than commitment and genuine love.

86.title: Rudd v Treasury, Faith School & Election 2013
86.plot: The Roast enables more election addicts, we look at Kevin Rudd's run in with the treasury, and Abbott discusses education at a school that considers homosexuality to be wrong: the Coalition is currently trying to find the wormhole that sent him to the 17th century.

87.title: Labor Campaign Launch, Asylum Seekers & Election 2013
87.plot: Tonight as the election campaign enters its final week we analyse further developments in the Coalitions' asylum seeker policy and, Labour officially launches its campaign for re-election. Forget everything that was said before. The campaign begins now.

88.title: Ad Blackout, Tony Abbott Profile & Election 2013
88.plot: Behold words at high speeds as we continue our election coverage, we take you on a tour of Tony Abbott's career, and anticipate the election ad blackout on Wednesday. In case of hunger for political venom, please break open Talkback Radio.

89.title: Rudd Profile, Abbott's Mandate & Election 2013
89.plot: The Roast nuzzles once more into the election's depths, we bring you our Kevin Rudd profile, and look at Abbott's threat to dissolve both houses. It's like Democracy meets The Block.

90.title: Party Profiles, Asylum Blackout & Election 2013
90.plot: The dolphins of the election once more wash up on The Roast's beaches, we bring you the profiles of some smaller parties, and the Coalition plan an asylum seeker news blackout. Personally, we think it's important to discuss Asy**$m Se## - to discuss the perfectly clear oceans.

91.title: Voting Guide, Policy Costings & Election 2013
91.plot: Like a lost puppy wandering through a minefield, the election has come to an expected end. We also guide you through the voting process, and look at the Coalition's recently handed-in policy costings which we've definitely had enough time to read: well-played.

92.title: Farewell Labor, Fringe Senate & Election 2013
92.plot: Join The Roast for an election wrap-up as we say goodbye to the Rudd-Gillard era, and hello to Family First and The Motoring Enthusiast parties in the senate. If you own a religious car, then this is the Senate for you.

93.title: Rudd Labor, Asylum Seekers & Election 2013
93.plot: The Roast looks at the election aftermath, the journalists who landed on Christmas Island and the growing calls from within the Labor Party for Kevin Rudd to retire for his party's sake. Have they ever met Kevin Rudd?

94.title: Senate Reform, Clive Palmer & Dennis Rodman
94.plot: The Roast examines the proposals to reform a divided Senate, Clive Palmer's controversial election campaign and everything else important that's happened in the news, especially why Dennis Rodman thinks he's important again.

95.title: Climate Change, Labor Leadership & Sophie Mirabella
95.plot: The Coalition is still in the midst of dismantling Labor's Clean Energy Finance Corporation and Labor is still in the midst of dismantling itself with infighting and leadership struggles.

96.title: Labor Leadership, Match Fixing & Cabinet
96.plot: The Roast slips into the headlines like a tasteful negligee, we look at allegations of match-fixing, and the Labor leadership battle: given Labor's recent track record, The Coalition may win that too.

97.title: Palmer on Q&A, New Cabinet & Asylum Seeker Policy
97.plot: The Roast longingly gazes at the headlines, Abbott's new cabinet, and Indonesia rejects Coalition asylum-seeker policy: lucky we're getting a 3-star general involved to keep things nice and simple.

98.title: Abbott Sworn In, Albanese Leadership Launch & Jensen Slams Abbott
98.plot: The Roast puts on its most flattering swimwear to dive into the headlines, Albanese launches ALP election and Abbott kicks off government of 'no surprises' by cutting everything. Surprise.

99.title: Coaltion Cuts, Abbott's First Day & Starbucks vs Guns
99.plot: The Roast gently feels a bump as it reverses over the headlines, we look at cuts to public servants, and we look at Abbott's first day in charge of women's affairs: expect women everywhere to be crying, we assume with happiness.

100.title: Barnett GST, Abbott Government & Pope Francis
100.plot: The Roast does a 5-point palm exploding heart technique on the headlines, we look at the first days of the new government and WA Premier Barnett asks Tony Abbott to consider raising the GST. Silly Barnett, he doesn't raise anything, he razes everything.

101.title: Saddam Hussein, Scott Morrison & George Brandis
101.plot: The Roast shows off its oily, headline-ripped body on the beach of current affairs, we look at the RBA's near-deal with Saddam Hussein's family, and the Coalition breaks its own asylum seeker blackout. Apparently, redact the boats wasn't working.

102.title: Debt Ceiling, Julia Gillard & Labor Leadership
102.plot: The Roast respectfully pushes the headlines out to sea on fire, the US leaves raising the debt ceiling to the absolute last second and Julia Gillard given warm response at first interview. Hopefully she doesn't do a Rudd and try and be PM again.

103.title: Abbott in Indonesia, US Shutdown & Millions for Liberal Democrats
103.plot: The Roast continues its fine tradition of ignoring punctuation in headlines, Tony Abbott's visit to Indonesia is a surprising success and the US government stops paying their employees so they can continue to pay their employees.

104.title: Abbott Returns, Black Market Closed & Senate Race
104.plot: The Roast eats headlines and regurgitates them into the mouths of its young, we look at Abbott's trip to Indonesia, and online black market Silk Road gets closed down: now you'll have to buy heroin in the shops.

105.title: Church Scandal, Fleet Review & Labor Leadership
105.plot: The Roast becomes satirically obese as it takes part in an all-you-can-eat headline contest, the Church gets embroiled in another scandal, and the Fleet Review arrives in Sydney: boat people Tony Abbott is actually pleased to see.

106.title: Wedding Scandal, John Robertson & APEC
106.plot: The Roast thrusts its hands deep into the pockets of the headlines, the wedding expense scandal engulfs Tony Abbott and NSW Labor leader refuses a bribe of $3 million. Typical: NSW Labor going above everyone else in corruption scandals.

107.title: Tax Scandal, Rinehart Trial & Malaysia Apology
107.plot: The Roast waits until the headlines are asleep and then tries on their clothes, we look at the Gina Rinehart trust fund trial, and there's more on Tony Abbott and tax money: where's a 3-star Tax General when you need one?

108.title: Labor Caucus, Balance of Power & Palmer on Lateline
108.plot: The Roast speeds off in a convertible, arm around the headlines' shoulders, the Palmer United Party may hold the balance of power in the Senate and the Labor leadership ballot goes to caucus: there's a 50/50 chance of Labor winning or winning.

109.title: US Shutdown, ACT Marriage Equality & MP Expenses
109.plot: The Roast opens its airlock and pushes the headlines into the cold vacuum of space, we cover the US Shutdown and federal government moves to block marriage equality in ACT: Tony Abbott may soon be able to sleep at night without fear of being gay-married.

110.title: Shorten Wins, Foreign Investments & Commbank ATMs
110.plot: The Sirens of the Roast sing seductively and smile as the headlines crash on its rocky shores, we have a profile of Bill Shorten and analyse Australia's relationship with China, where this episode was made.

111.title: Twiggy Forest, Labor Frontbench & Queensland Casinos
111.plot: The Roast travels back in time and terminates the headlines' parents, we look at the winners and losers from Labor's frontbench announcement and we learn that QLD may soon have seven casinos. One more and they get a free gambling addiction clinic.

112.title: Carbon Tax, Michael Williamson & Geoff Shaw
112.plot: The Roast deliberately leaves the headlines at the altar, union boss Michael Williamson pleads guilty to corruption and Abbott threatens double-dissolution election if Carbon Tax not repealed. Sounds like a gold medallist who wants to do two laps of honour.

113.title: HECS Debt, US Default & Nicola Roxon
113.plot: The Roast plunges the headlines into debt and then seizes its home, HECS debt may one day get privatised and the US avoids default by finally agreeing to raise the debt-ceiling: China relieved Obama can finally borrow more.

114.title: Tasmania Euthenasia, QLD Bikie Laws & US Shutdown
114.plot: The Roast changes all of the headlines' passwords, we look at the defeat of a Tasmanian euthanasia bill and anti-bikie laws pass in QLD. Good thing bikies are well known to obey the law.

115.title: Adam Bandt Twitter, Opera House Birthday & Asylum Seekers
115.plot: The Roast organises a murderous clown for the headlines birthday, we politicise the Adam Bandt debate and asylum seekers are back in the news. Is it good news? Of course not, what world do you live in?

116.title: US Spying, Senate Bypass & Titanic 2 Movie
116.plot: The Roast swaps faces with the headlines and masquerades as a member of its family, US spying on France is confirmed, and the Coalition might bypass the Senate on its Direct Action policy: wow, that policy really lives up to its name.

117.title: ACT Same Sex Marriage, Debt Ceiling & 2DayFM
117.plot: The Roast "forgets" its wallet and leaves the headlines with the bill, the Coalition plans to oppose ACT same-sex marriage, and Australia to raise its debt-ceiling: now we can afford to have more nothing.

118.title: Bob Carr, Al Gore vs Abbott & Prince George
118.plot: The Roast strands the headlines on an iceberg and then increases carbon emissions, Bob Carr suddenly retires, and Al Gore weighs in on Australia's climate policies: we have climate policies?

119.title: NSA Spying, Greg Hunt & Mining Tax
119.plot: The Roast lets the headlines evolve over millions of years only to tell them it was all a bearded sky man, the Coalition to make cuts so it can repeal the Mining Tax and more revelations of NSA spying. Watch the Roast in complete darkness to ensure privacy.

imdb.title: The Roast
plot: _The Roast_ (qv) is a daily ten minute comedy news show that promises to destroy every bastion of journalism known to man.
